Support Empire State Editions

Empire State Editions is committed to publishing outstanding books on the history, culture, and diversity of New York State.

If you would like to help the Press achieve our goals by making a donation, please contact Margaret Noonan by emailing [email protected] or by phone, 646-868-4206.

Contact Information

For reprint requests: 
HarperCollins Publishers, 10 East 53rd St., New York, NY 10022

For queries about film or dramatic rights:  
Ron Bernstein, International Creative Management, 10250 Constellation Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA  90057

For other rights queries:  
Frances Goldin Literary Agency, 57 E. 11th Street #5B, New York, NY  10003

For inquiries about the Bellwether Prize:

For information about Animal, Vegetable, Miracle:

Other requests:  
Judy Carmichael, Office of Barbara Kingsolver, PO Box 160, Meadowview VA 24361

About public speaking:  

Please note that Barbara does not work with any speakers’ bureau, because she does not accept fees for public speaking.

About book jacket endorsments:  

Every year, Barbara receives hundreds of requests to read and endorse manuscripts, most of them apparently beautifully written and utterly deserving of her support.

If she had superpowers, and nothing else to do, she could read them all and write a jacket blurb for each, creating a ubiquitous rubber-stamp endorsement.

If she had a cold heart, she could choose among these equally deserving candidates and help a few, while shunning all others.

If she had a nepotistic nature, she would endorse those written by friends, acquaintances, people who once met her parents, etc., and ignore the rest.

Alas, she has none of the above, and is therefore unsuited for writing jacket quotes for any book or manuscript, however wondrous. Not ever. Sorry.

About fan mail:  

Barbara loves reading letters from readers. Fan mail has given her a long list of reasons to keep writing books. Because of the volume, however, she regrets that she can’t write individual responses. If you have a particular question you may find the answer elsewhere on this website (see FAQs). Because of the quantity of communications, in an office staffed by one full-time human, we don’t encourage emails or telephone calls.

Report a Review

This service is designed to allow HPFF users to alert the staff about inappropriate reviews.

Review:TheHeirOfSlytherin says:
:O REMUS! He's, what, eight years old? And adorable. I wanted to hug him and tell him everything was okay.

I love that Greyback has that level of compassion, for Teddy and Remus. Which is why I imagine this to be before he became the evil person we see him as in Harry's eyes. But after hearing all those stories, I'd have thought Teddy wouldn't be so friendly with him, even if he was a great actor. He wouldn't be able to keep everything from him, if he had hated him. So it's interesting to know what he's been told.

How does Greyback know his name?

I can't wait for the next chapter, Mike.

Review:DontBeSilly says:
This story seems pretty interesting. I can tell I'm gonna have to devote some time to it. You've got alot of chapters up. But don't worry, I'm not intimidated. I can't wait to delve into it. :P

Author's Response: Thank you for your review. I hope you like it enough to keep reading it!
